review_title: Good Culture, Good Benefits, Good People
job_title: Admissions Counselor in North Newton, KS
pros:
- Community-based environment, where you'll regularly have the opportunity to interact with people outside your department
- Helpful co-workers
- Based in a small community, so you can get connected to people around town easily
- College is a center of activity; lots to do on campus!
- Very fulfilling work, can feel good about helping students find their best-fit college
- Good vacation, insurance, sick leave, etc.; the administration wants to help employees
cons: - as a small college, can't offer the highest pay (but makes up for it with good benefits, especially for the industry)

review_title: Great Place to Work, Good Culture
job_title: Anonymous Employee in North Newton, KS
pros:
Bethel College supports all walks of life and strives to make all students and staff feel included and safe.
Staff rallies around each other and takes interest in your success.
Seeing students grow and achieve success is very rewarding.
cons:
Being a small, private institution, pay is less than market.
The college is very close-knit. A person may feel isolated at first but with time and persistence, a person can create close connections.
No clear path for advancement for most staff roles.

job_title: Assistant Professor in North Newton, KS
pros: As a professor I was given complete freedom in the classroom.  There was also a good sense of collegiality.
cons: Bethel is not the place to work if you disagree with identity politics or general liberal views.  Conservative voices are ridiculed and drowned out which is against what the college claims as welcoming to all.  Do not be fooled, this is not a Christian college in the values they embrace or the lives the students are allowed to live on campus.   Mennonite culture is stubborn and not open to new ideas or innovation.  That's why they dont have online or masters programs.  Board of directors is clueless about running a school.
